text: The weight on my chest is crushing. Just a small cut might offer a release, even fleetingly.
I feel so empty and alone.  There's a blade in the drawer, calling my name.
Everything is spinning out of control. Pain feels like the only thing I can control.
I hate myself, I can't handle things. I deserve to be punished.
No one understands.  Maybe if I hurt myself, they'll finally see how much I'm suffering.
The scars are ugly. I can add a few more without it really mattering. It can be my reminder of hurt and neglect.
I just want the bad feelings to stop, and hurting seems like the fastest way.
What is there to even live for? Nothing. Cutting will help.
It's like the devil whispering in my ear. Just once. Just a little bit.
Everyone will be better off if I'm gone. It can just go from little cuts to even less reason to live.
It's not about wanting to die; it's about wanting the pain to stop for a while.
Maybe the ache on my skin will overpower the ache in my heart, even temporarily.
Self-harm makes me feel like I'm something real in this unreal situation. It is what I deserve.
It is an addiction to making pain go away by causing more.
My parents' voices are echoing in my head. Time for a dose of what they were giving me.
There is blood caked and dried on the blade, it has a purpose. Maybe I do too.
I have so many memories. Self-harm drowns them out a little.
How do I get the blood to flow better? There isn't enough right now.
I have made so many mistakes in my life. Is there a point to living?
This blade feels nice and smooth against my wrist, a very light and comfortable feeling.
Sometimes, the pain inside feels unbearable, like a storm raging without end.
I feel so alone, adrift in a sea of sadness with no land in sight.
The world feels too heavy to carry, and I just want the weight to disappear.
It's like there's a constant battle inside, a war that I'm always losing.
I just wish there was a way to turn off the noise, to find a moment of peace.
The scars feel like a reminder of everything I've been through, and I don't know how to heal.
Sometimes, it feels like I'm trapped in a dark tunnel with no light at the end.
I feel disconnected from everyone and everything, like I'm watching life from behind glass.
It's a struggle to get out of bed each day, to face another day of feeling this way.
I just want to feel okay, to feel like I'm enough, but it seems so far away.
The hurt feels like it's seeping into every part of my being, poisoning everything.
I don't know how to ask for help, or if anyone would even understand.
It's like I'm drowning in my own emotions, gasping for air that never comes.
The world keeps spinning, but I feel stuck in one place, unable to move forward.
Sometimes, the only thing that makes sense is to feel something, even if it's pain.
I feel invisible, like no one sees the struggle I'm going through.
It's a constant cycle of feeling down, and I don't know how to break free.
The pressure is overwhelming, and I just want it all to stop.
I feel so lost and confused, like I'm wandering aimlessly through life.
Sometimes, I feel like I'm a burden to everyone around me, and it's hard to shake that feeling.
The weight on my chest feels unbearable, a constant pressure I can't seem to shake. Everything feels so gray and heavy.
Sometimes, the only thing that makes sense is the feeling of control, even if it's fleeting and destructive.
It's like I'm screaming inside, but no one can hear me. The silence is deafening and suffocating.
The world moves on, but I'm stuck in this loop of sadness and despair, unable to find a way out.
Apathy has taken over. Nothing brings joy anymore, and even the things I used to love feel meaningless.
Sharp edges and fleeting pain provide a perverse sense of clarity amidst the chaos in my mind.
I feel like a failure, constantly disappointing everyone around me, including myself. It never ends.
Tears blur my vision as I struggle to breathe. Each breath feels like a monumental effort.
The mirror reflects a stranger back at me, someone I no longer recognize or understand.
Lost in a labyrinth of emotions, I search for an exit, but every path leads back to the same darkness.
It's a release. A way to feel something, anything, instead of the numb emptiness that consumes me.
The pain is a language I understand, a twisted comfort in a world that feels alien and hostile.
Each day is a battle, a fight against the shadows that lurk in the corners of my mind. I'm so tired.
Scars tell a story, a silent scream etched onto my skin, a testament to the battles fought and lost.
The urge is overwhelming, a magnetic pull towards the darkness, a siren song promising oblivion.
I isolate myself, building walls around my heart, afraid of letting anyone see the brokenness within.
Everything feels fragile, like a single wrong word could shatter me into a million pieces.
Sleep offers a temporary escape, a brief respite from the torment, but the morning always comes.
I feel invisible, like I don't matter, like my existence is insignificant in the grand scheme of things.
The pressure builds, a volcano ready to erupt, threatening to consume everything in its path.
The dull ache was a familiar friend, a constant reminder in the quiet moments.
Sometimes, the storm inside needs an outlet, a release I can control.
The world felt muted, distant, and the only real thing was the burning sensation.
A secret language etched onto skin, understood only by the bearer.
I watched the blood well, a crimson bloom against pale skin, a strange fascination.
The numbness crept in, a welcome blanket against the sharp edges of reality.
Each scar a story, a testament to battles fought and barely survived.
I craved the sharp sting, a grounding force in a world that felt increasingly unreal.
The shame coiled tight in my stomach, but the relief was a fleeting balm.
It was a ritual, a dance with darkness performed in the solitude of my own mind.
The air hung thick with unspoken words, with feelings too big to contain.
It's like carving a hole to let the pressure escape. Just a temporary release.
I’m so empty and this is the only way I can feel anything at all.
A perverse form of control. Owning the pain rather than the pain owning me.
I feel the guilt, the regret, and the need rising again. The cycle never ends.
It's a desperate cry for help, but no one seems to hear me when I'm actually calling out.
Each cut is a silent scream, a moment of rebellion against my own existence.
Tonight, the darkness is overwhelming. It whispers temptations I can’t resist.
It's a physical manifestation of the chaos within, a visible wound for invisible pain.
The scars map out my pain, a geography etched in self-inflicted hurt.
Sometimes, the pain inside feels overwhelming, like a storm raging without end.
It's a heavy weight to carry, this sadness that lingers and shadows every thought.
The mirror reflects back a stranger, someone I barely recognize anymore.
Silence screams louder than words ever could, echoing the emptiness inside.
Each day feels like a battle, a fight to stay afloat in a sea of despair.
The world fades into gray, losing its color and vibrancy with each passing moment.
Numbness creeps in, a shield against the sharpness of reality's sting.
Lost in the labyrinth of my own mind, searching for a way out, a guiding light.
Tears fall silently, unnoticed in the darkness that engulfs everything.
A fragile hope flickers faintly, threatened by the winds of doubt and fear.
The pressure builds, an unbearable weight threatening to crush me completely.
I feel like I am drowning in a sea of emotion, struggling to find air.
Invisible wounds ache, a constant reminder of past hurts and present pain.
Disconnected from everything, like a ghost drifting through a world I no longer belong to.
Thoughts become tangled and knotted, an intricate web of confusion and despair.
The darkness wraps around me like a shroud, suffocating the life within.
Longing for peace, for a moment of respite from the relentless storm within.
Feeling trapped, caught in a cycle of pain that seems impossible to break.
The weight of the world feels like it's resting solely on my shoulders.
Everything feels too difficult, an insurmountable challenge with no clear solution.
